intro: Hieracium apatelium, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Hieracium apatelium is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common weed in various environments.
